recipes.title: Mac and Blue
recipes.description: A jack and blue cheese macaroni dish that can work great as a stand-alone dish, or as a side for Thanksgiving. The trick is to add only a small amount of the blue cheese because the jack is far less aggressive. Great topped with walnuts!
directions: 1. Toast walnuts. Preheat oven to 350. Place walnuts on baking sheet and back for approx. 5-10 minutes.
2. Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until a little less than al dente. Then drain.

3. Add the sauce and cheeses to a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Stir until cheese is barely melted, about 3 minutes. Slowly add the cooked pasta, stir, and continue cooking over medium heat while stirring continuosly until hot.

recipes.title: Chicken Croissant Melts
recipes.description: Croissant style chicken sandwich that is incredible! The sprouts and avocado give this dish and upscale appeal.
ingredients: 6 ounces thinly sliced cooked chicken or turkey
directions: 1. Cook bacon until crisp, drain and crumble
2. Combine bacon, cream cheese, parmesan cheese, onion and sour cream, stirring until well blended. Spread onto cut sides of croissants
3. Layer chicken, tomatoes, avocado and cheese on bottom of croissant and place on baking sheet. Broil 5.5 inches from heat, for about 1 minute, or until cheese melts
4. Top with alfalfa sprouts and croissant tops

recipes.title: Savory Grilled Steak
recipes.description: A tender, boneless rib-eye marinated in a perfect blend of spices and grilled to perfection
directions: 1. Mix seasoning, olive oil and Dale's
2. Coat steaks on both sides and let them marinate for 1 hour
3. Cook steaks to your desired tempature (rare, medium, well-done)

recipes.title: Jalapeno Poppers
recipes.description: A classic appetizer, the Jalapeno pepper filled with cream cheese and cheddar
ingredients: 6 three-inch long jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise, ribs and seeds removed
directions: 1. In a medium bowl throughly combine the cream cheese, cheddar chees, onion powerder, garlic powder, and smoked paprika. Stir in the hot sauce to taste. Season with salt and pepper
2. Season the cavity of each havled pepper with salt and pepper. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of filling into each seasoned cavity (it should fill the cavity and create a small, rounded mound)

3. In a bowl, combine the tempura batter and club soda: whisk unitl smooth. Place the flour and breadcrumbs on 2 separate plates. Working 1 piece at a time, thoroughly coat the stuffed peppers in the flour, then in the tempura batter mixture, then in the breadcrumbs (pressing to adhere). Transfer to a plate. Refriderate for at least 20 minutes to set.

In a large, high-sided pan (or cast iron skillet), heat 1/2 inche of the oil on medium-high until hot. Once hot enough that a pinch of flour sizzles immediately when added to the pan, working in batches, add the breaded peppers. Cook 45 seconds to 1 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate and immediately season with salt. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving
